How do constraint sizes affect results?

```{julia}
include("../pipelines.jl")
truenet, c1 = loadTrueData("n40h4")
```



```{julia}
subs2 = njHierarchDecomp(majorTree(truenet), 16)    # this misses hybrid #H4
subs3 = njHierarchDecomp(majorTree(truenet), 8)     # this misses hybrid #H1 & #H4
subs3[6] = [subs3[6]; subs3[7]]
deleteat!(subs3, 7)

c2 = pruneTruthFromDecomp(truenet, subs2)
c3 = pruneTruthFromDecomp(truenet, subs3)
```

The smaller subsets miss the reticulations, but they still estimate the network w/o reticulations perfectly.

```{julia}
mnet1 = runGroundTruthPipeline(truenet, c1)
mnet2 = runGroundTruthPipeline(truenet, c2)
mnet3 = runGroundTruthPipeline(truenet, c3)

rf1 = hardwiredClusterDistance(truenet, mnet1, false)
rf2 = hardwiredClusterDistance(truenet, mnet2, false)
rf3 = hardwiredClusterDistance(truenet, mnet3, false)

hardwiredClusterDistance(majorTree(truenet), majorTree(mnet1), false) ==
    hardwiredClusterDistance(majorTree(truenet), majorTree(mnet2), false) ==
    hardwiredClusterDistance(majorTree(truenet), majorTree(mnet3), false) == 0.
```
